ref: 14478 *CAGH: mng. of Aś. caghati is prob. ʻ is likely to ʼ (paralled with laghaṁti with inf. < *alaghaṁti = *arghanti: cf. Pa. a(.l. sagghasi with v.l. agghasi). Orig. mngs. of √*cagh: (1) ʻ rise ʼ in B. cāgā (caggh<-> sanskritized as carghati ʻ goes ʼ W.?); (2) ʻ rise against ʼ in Kho. čagéik ʻ to overthrow ʼ (cf. caghnōti ʻ kills ʼ, cah(ay)ati ʻ cheats ʼ Dhātup.: semant. cf. √gur ʻ raise ʼ ~ gūryatē ʻ hurts, goes ʼ Dhātup.); (3) ʻ is likely ʼ in Aš. caghati and B. cāgā ʻ to be inclined ʼ (J. C. W.). -- See also √*cāh Add.
